Summary

I am a frontend web developer with five years of professional experience. Before going freelance, I worked as an early employee for Steem, building user-facing apps and backend micro-services, with React on their blockchain as it scaled to 1M+ users. I have been learning Rust more recently, using it to make a static site generator. I am excited by any opportunity to use Rust's powerful features in production, particularly when it can complement my experience with Typescript and React.

Experience

Freelance

05/2020 - Present

Develop useful software for a variety of clients

Fullstack developer

Working as a lead developer with a local and remote team of graphic and product designers to implement creative and b2b software briefs for a range of clients, including General Motors.

  • https://hobbes.work - a portfolio site for a UI/UX studio using a modern Jamstack, a customized headless CMS, and a React/Typescript frontend
  • https://means.tv - a media streaming platform with subscription features
  • https://psilabs.org - laboratory process tracking software and web front end, so customers can track their samples and publicize test results.
  • A custom CRM for General Motors in React and NodeJS - used at Dealerships and special events nationwide.

03/2018 - 05/2020

Developed applications for the Steem blockchain

Fullstack Developer

Worked as part of a remote agile team with 3 other developers, to develop and scale open source blockchain software (https://github.com/steemit) used by millions of users and processing millions of dollars in cryptocurrency transactions.

  • Built the most popular frontend (React/Typescript) for the Steem blockchain, including authorization, market trading, and cryptocurrency wallet features
  • https://steemit.com - A reddit clone written in React, scaling from a few thousand to millions of users internationally

  • https://wallet.steemit.com - Feature-rich cryptocurrency wallet including trading, exchange and withdrawal
